history.text: It sounds like people rated this  movie highly
It's a thrilling action adventure saga with exhilarating 3-D animation

more coming-of
 age dramedy
Yes, though it devotes too much time to arial Dragon battles
Yes, but it rouses you in conventional ways but its also the rare animated film that uses 3-D for its breathtaking spatial and emotional possibillities
It doesn't have a lot of character development
But is surprisingly sweet and poignant

Yes but you have to agree that How to train your dragon comes close to the level of Pixars out put while easily exceeding the juvenilia Dream
works has released in the last nine years

Nothing stronger then
 a good friendship between man and animal
The duo who directed How to train your Dragon also directed Lilo & Stitch
IAnd they cast some cool people, Jay Baruchel as Hiccup  for example
Gerard Butler and Craig Ferguson are big names too
I hadn't heard of the directors though, is Chris Sanders a big name?
He takes a backseat to all the A-listers, Jonah Hill, TJ Miller, & Kristen Wig
That makes  sense. Not everyone can be a big name. With how well the movie rated, it must've been a big thing for his career
I like that they subverted the trope by having Hiccup not kill the dragon
I like the scene when Hiccup finds the Night Fury dragon, and he gets over his fear of dragons
Do you like movies about Dragons?
I didn't like the part when Toothless was struggling to fly over the bolas, that was a tough scene to watch
Yes, i like Dragons. They're super cool and can fly! I'd like to fly like hiccup and toothless
Yeah that's sad, though when he gets the prosthesis it's awesome
The kid is pretty much a genius to figure that out at age 15
Brains over Braun
Yeah, that seems like a moral of the movie. Be smart
I was sad when Hiccup got disowned
Yep, plus he lost his leg
rough stuff for a guy just trying to make peace
Yeah, so now he matches toothless
I didn't like when they defeated Red Death, it was too unbelievable
that dragon was a beast
It was huge! Though with a name like red death, you would expect that
Times were tougher back then
